p: Nurses are frontline workers providing care for patients, and they struggle with many ethical challenges when providing patient care. Nurses are often faced with everyday ethical decisions in nursing practice that may seem insignificant but which may be stressful for nurses, as they must face the question of what is right and what is wrong ( 15). This is particularly the case during these times, given the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic around the globe. The present study aimed to explore nurses' ethics in the care of patients with COVID-19, considering the fact that it may become particularly difficult for nurses to offer their care and help during a pandemic like the COVID-19 pandemic.
